title: Jessica Mauboy reveals she passionately supports the ban on climbing Uluru
text:
She's the much-loved musician who is proud of her indigenous heritage.

And in a new interview with Stellar, Jessica Mauboy voiced her opinion on the decision to ban climbing up sacred heritage sight Uluru, which takes place at the end of the month.

In the candid chat, the 30-year-old revealed she passionately supports the ban - exclaiming she feels haunted that it's 'even an argument'.

'Touch the rock from its base and you will feel everything you need to feel': Jessica Mauboy (pictured) revealed she passionately supports the Uluru hiking ban in this week's Stellar

From October 26, visitors will no longer be allowed to walk up the huge rock, in a historic decision made by the Uluru-Kata Tjuta National Park Board of Management.

While many opposed the ban, Jessica - whose family originate from the Indigenous tribe KuKu Yalanj - said: 'When you consider the power of this rock and its history... why doesn't it make sense to people?

'You can't deny the feelings you have standing there and it haunts me that this is even an argument.'

'Why doesn't it make sense to people?' Jessica couldn't understand why many continue to argue against the ban, which will take place from October 26

Jess headed to the world-famous site to shoot the October cover for the magazine - and confirmed that even just being in the surroundings made her feel 'grounded, awake and present'.

She added: 'Touch the rock from its base and you will feel everything you need to feel.'

Jessica posed in front of the famous landmark in one of the sensational shots, flashing her never-ending pins in a glittery silver gown.

Fun in the sun! Jessica looked sensational as she lay on the floor with her feet sinking into the sand, smiling widely as she enjoyed the beautiful sunset

A different look: Jessica later dressed in a pair of orange pleather flares and a patterned top, casually tucking one side in at the waist as she glared seductively at the camera

The sultry number showed off Jessica's ample assets beautifully, as she beamed bare-foot in the jaw-dropping surroundings.

In a completely different look, Jessica later was seen sporting an orange pair of pleather flares and a patterned top.

She casually tucked one side in at the waist, as she glared seductively at the camera.

The full interview appears in this week's Stellar magazine.
description: She's the much-loved musician who is proud of her indigenous heritage.
authors: Nicole Douglas For Daily Mail Australia
